title: Elephant & Piggie: Today I Will Fly!
author: Mo Willems
description: Gerald and Piggie are best friends! In this hilarious easy reader, Piggie is determined to fly. Will she succeed? A perfect book for beginning readers with simple text and big laughs!

title: Frog and Toad Are Friends
author: Arnold Lobel
description: Meet two best friends - Frog and Toad! Through five heartwarming stories, these lovable characters show what true friendship means. Perfect for early readers learning about kindness and loyalty.

title: The Princess in Black
author: Shannon Hale
description: Princess Magnolia has a secret! When monsters threaten her kingdom, she transforms into the Princess in Black. Action, humor, and girl power combine in this exciting early chapter book series.

title: Magic Tree House: Dinosaurs Before Dark
author: Mary Pope Osborne
description: Jack and Annie discover a magical tree house that takes them back to the time of dinosaurs! The first book in the beloved series that makes history exciting for young readers.

title: Narwhal: Unicorn of the Sea
author: Ben Clanton
description: Narwhal is a happy-go-lucky narwhal who thinks he's the unicorn of the sea! When he meets Jelly, a no-nonsense jellyfish, an unlikely friendship blooms. A charming graphic novel for early readers.

title: Mercy Watson to the Rescue
author: Kate DiCamillo
description: Mercy Watson is a porcine wonder who loves butter toast! When the Watsons' bed crashes through the floor, can Mercy save the day? A hilarious early chapter book perfect for reluctant readers.

title: Pete the Cat: I Love My White Shoes
author: Eric Litwin
description: Pete the Cat walks down the street in his brand new white shoes. But what happens when he steps in strawberries, blueberries, and mud? A groovy story about staying positive no matter what!

title: Dog Man
author: Dav Pilkey
description: Part dog, part man, all hero! When a police dog and his cop partner are injured, they're combined to create Dog Man. Action-packed graphic novel fun from the creator of Captain Underpants!

title: Owl Diaries: Eva's Treetop Festival
author: Rebecca Elliott
description: Check out how these amazing real life creatures match up. Who's the strongest, fastest, biggest and baddest? In a fight to the finish, who would win?

title: The Bad Guys
author: Aaron Blabey
description: Mr. Wolf wants to be good, not bad! He recruits his friends Mr. Snake, Mr. Piranha, and Mr. Shark to do good deeds. But can bad guys really change? A hilarious graphic novel that challenges stereotypes.

title: Junie B. Jones and the Stupid Smelly Bus
author: Barbara Park
description: Meet Junie B. Jones! She's starting kindergarten and she's NOT happy about riding the school bus. Follow her funny, honest adventures that capture the ups and downs of being six.

title: Amelia Bedelia
author: Peggy Parish
description: Amelia Bedelia takes everything literally! When the Rogers family asks her to 'draw the drapes' or 'dress the chicken,' hilarious mix-ups happen. A beloved classic about a well-meaning housekeeper who always gets things wonderfully wrong.

title: Nate the Great
author: Marjorie Weinman Sharmat
description: Nate the Great is a boy detective who solves neighborhood mysteries with logic, determination, and a little help from his dog Sludge. Pancakes optional but highly recommended!

title: Henry and Mudge
author: Cynthia Rylant
description: Henry loves his big dog Mudge, and Mudge loves Henry. Together they have wonderful adventures and face everyday challenges with friendship, humor, and lots of slobbery kisses.

title: Dragons Love Tacos
author: Adam Rubin
description: Dragons LOVE tacos! They'll eat beef tacos, chicken tacos, and great big crispy tacos. But whatever you do, don't feed them anything with spicy salsa! A laugh-out-loud favorite.

title: The Day You Begin
author: Jacqueline Woodson
description: A #1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER! Featured in its own episode in the Netflix original show Bookmarks: Celebrating Black Voices! National Book Award winner Jacqueline Woodson and two-time Pura Belpré Illustrator Award winner Rafael López have teamed up to create a poignant, yet heartening book about...

title: Where the Wild Things Are
author: Maurice Sendak
description: Max has been sent to bed without supper. But once in his bedroom, his imagination comes alive with forests, jungles, wild beasts, and almost scary monsters.

title: Green Eggs and Ham
author: Dr. Seuss
description: The classic Dr. Seuss rhyming story about all the places green eggs and ham can be eaten. Can the reader remember all the places at the end?

title: Last Stop on Market Street
author: Matt de la Peña
description: Every Sunday, CJ rides the bus across town with his grandma. He wishes he had more, but Nana helps him see the beauty all around them. A beautiful story about gratitude and seeing the world with wonder.

title: Rosie Revere, Engineer
author: Andrea Beaty
description: A young aspiring engineer must first conquer her fear of failure.

title: Waiting Is Not Easy!
author: Mo Willems
description: Gerald is careful. Piggie is not. Piggie cannot help smiling. Gerald can. Gerald worries so that Piggie does not have to. Gerald and Piggie are best friends. In Waiting Is Not Easy!, Piggie has a surprise for Gerald, but he is going to have to wait for it. And Wait. And wait some more...

title: Cornbread & Poppy
author: Matthew Cordell
description: A piercing and scientifically grounded look at the emergence of the coronavirus pandemic and how it will change the way we live--"excellent and timely." (The New Yorker) Apollo's Arrow offers a riveting account of the impact of the coronavirus pandemic as it swept through American society in 2020...

title: Knight Owl
author: Christopher Denise
description: After achieving his dream of becoming a knight, a small owl protects the castle from a hungry dragon.

title: Ivy + Bean
author: Annie Barrows
description: When seven-year-old Bean plays a mean trick on her sister, she finds unexpected support for her antics from Ivy, the new neighbor, who is less boring than Bean first suspected.

title: Press Here
author: Hervé Tullet
description: A clever book to fire the imagination. The reader presses dots, shakes pages, pulls tabs – and creates their own magic trick-like adventure. A great book for emerging readers and ideal for reading and discussing with your child. A great 1st grade storybook to share with reluctant readers.

title: Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus!
author: Mo Willems
description: When a bus driver takes a break from his route, a very unlikely volunteer springs up to take his place-a pigeon! But you've never met one like this before. As he pleads, wheedles, and begs his way through the book, children will love being able to answer back and decide his fate. In his hilarious...

title: Goodnight Moon
author: Margaret Wise Brown
description: In a great green room, a little bunny says goodnight to everything around him. This gentle bedtime story has helped millions of children drift off to sleep for over 70 years.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
description: Follow a tiny caterpillar as he eats his way through the week, munching everything from apples to lollipops! Watch him transform into a beautiful butterfly in this classic that teaches counting and days of the week.

title: Click, Clack, Moo: Cows That Type
author: Doreen Cronin
description: Farmer Brown's cows discover a typewriter and start making demands! When they go on strike for electric blankets, it leads to hilarious barnyard negotiations.

title: Brown Bear, Brown Bear, What Do You See?
author: Bill Martin Jr.
description: Ideal for reluctant and emerging readers, this is a great rhyming book with repetition and stunning pictures.

title: If You Give a Mouse a Cookie
author: Laura Numeroff
description: If you give a mouse a cookie, he's going to ask for a glass of milk. And then... one thing leads to another in this circular tale of cause and effect that kids love to predict!

title: Llama Llama Red Pajama
author: Anna Dewdney
description: Llama, Llama red pajama waiting, waiting for his mama. Mama isn't coming yet. Baby Llama starts to fret. In this infectious rhyming read-aloud, Baby Llama turns bedtime into an all-out llama drama! Tucked into bed by his mama, Baby Llama immediately starts worrying when she goes downstairs, and h...

title: Corduroy
author: Don Freeman
description: A small teddy bear in a department store wants nothing more than a home and a friend. When Lisa discovers him, it's the beginning of a beautiful friendship.

title: The Cat in the Hat
author: Dr. Seuss
description: It's a rainy day and Sally and her brother are bored. Then the Cat in the Hat arrives with his crazy tricks! But will they clean up before Mother gets home? Pure Dr. Seuss chaos and fun!

title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
author: Crockett Johnson
description: Armed with his purple crayon, Harold draws himself into wonderful adventures, creating entire worlds with his imagination. Where will his purple line take him tonight?

title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
author: Judith Viorst
description: Viorst's classic tale of a little boy who must accept the reality that "some days are like that," when everything he does goes awry, is one of her most popular works. "The clever text shines."--"School Library Journal," starred review. ALA Notable Children's Book. Full color. Copyright © Libri Gm...

title: Madeline
author: Ludwig Bemelmans
description: In an old house in Paris covered with vines, lived twelve little girls in two straight lines. The smallest one was Madeline! A brave little girl with a spirit that can't be tamed.

title: Caps for Sale
author: Esphyr Slobodkina
description: Caps for Sale is a timeless classic, in print for over fifty years, and beloved by generations of readers. This easy-to-read story about a peddler and a band of mischievous monkeys is filled with warmth, humor, and simplicity. Children will delight in following the peddlers efforts to outwit the ...

title: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs
author: Judi Barrett
description: Life is delicious in the town of Chewandswallow where food falls from the skies--until the weather takes a turn for the worse.

title: Giraffes Can't Dance
author: Giles Andreae
description: The bestselling Giraffes Can't Dance is now a board book Giraffes Can't Dance is a touching tale of Gerald the giraffe, who wants nothing more than to dance. With crooked knees and thin legs, it's harder for a giraffe than you would think. Gerald is finally able to dance to his own tune when he g...

title: The Snowy Day
author: Ezra Jack Keats
description: Peter wakes up to discover fresh snow! He explores his neighborhood, making snow angels and saving a snowball in his pocket. A timeless story celebrating wonder and discovery.

title: Room on the Broom
author: Julia Donaldson
description: This fun family read-aloud is the perfect way to start Halloween celebrations and an ideal gift book. A sweet story of quick wits, friendship, and inclusivity from the creators of The Gruffalo! The witch and her cat are happily flying through the sky on a broomstick when the wind picks up and blo...

title: The Gruffalo
author: Julia Donaldson
description: A clever mouse invents a scary monster called the Gruffalo to scare off predators in the deep dark wood. But what happens when the Gruffalo turns out to be real?

title: Go, Dog. Go!
author: P.D. Eastman
description: Dogs of all kinds doing all sorts of things! Going up, down, in, out, and all around. A simple, fun book perfect for beginning readers.

title: Are You My Mother?
author: P.D. Eastman
description: A baby bird falls from his nest and searches everywhere for his mother. Is she a kitten? A hen? A dog? A snort? Kids love this funny tale of a determined little bird.

title: A Bear Called Paddington
author: Michael Bond
description: The classic novel about Paddington—who's now a major movie star! Paddington Bear had traveled all the way from Peru when the Browns first met him in Paddington Station. Since then, their lives have never been quite the same . . . for ordinary things become extraordinary when a bear called Padding...

title: Winnie-the-Pooh
author: A.A. Milne
description: Join Pooh Bear and his friends Piglet, Eeyore, Tigger, and Christopher Robin for gentle adventures in the Hundred Acre Wood. Honey optional!

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
description: Wilbur the pig and Charlotte the spider form an unlikely friendship. When Wilbur's life is in danger, Charlotte weaves words in her web to save him in this timeless tale of friendship and sacrifice.

title: Stuart Little
author: E.B. White
description: Stuart Little is a mouse born to a human family in New York City. Despite his small size, he has big adventures and an even bigger heart.

title: Mr. Popper's Penguins
author: Richard Atwater
description: When house painter Mr. Popper receives a penguin from Antarctica, it's just the beginning! Soon his family home is filled with a dozen performing penguins.

title: Biscuit
author: Alyssa Satin Capucilli
description: Woof! Woof! It's time for bed, but Biscuit wants to have a snack, and play, and hear stories. Will he ever go to sleep?

title: Little Bear
author: Else Holmelund Minarik
description: A collection of three Little Bear books.

title: The Pigeon Finds a Hot Dog!
author: Mo Willems
description: Pigeon learns about sharing when a curious duckling keeps asking questions about the hot dog Pigeon has found.

title: Flat Stanley
author: Jeff Brown
description: After a bulletin board falls on Stanley Lambchop, he's only half an inch thick! Being flat has advantages though - like being mailed to California for vacation!

title: The Kissing Hand
author: Audrey Penn
description: Chester Raccoon doesn't want to go to kindergarten. His mother shares a family secret called the Kissing Hand to comfort him. Perfect for first-day-of-school jitters!

title: Pinkalicious
author: Victoria Kann
description: Pinkalicious loves the color pink so much that she eats too many pink cupcakes and turns pink herself! A delightful story about moderation with magical pink illustrations.

title: Danny and the Dinosaur
author: Syd Hoff
description: Danny loves dinosaurs. When he sees one at the museun and says, "It would be nice to play with a dinosaur," a voice answers, "And I think it would be nice to play with you." So begins Dannys and the dinosaur's wonderful adventure together! But a dinosaur is no ordinary playmate. Even the most eve...

title: Chrysanthemum
author: Kevin Henkes
description: Chrysanthemum loves her name—until she starts school and the other students make fun of it. A touching story about self-acceptance and the power of a kind teacher.

title: A Color of His Own
author: Leo Lionni
description: A little chameleon is sad that he doesn't have his own color like goldfish, elephants, and parrots do. But being able to change colors turns out to be a special gift all its own!

title: Fly Guy
author: Tedd Arnold
description: This is Fly Guy. Is he a pest or is he a pet? Listen as you read along with this book and CD set.

title: Splat the Cat
author: Rob Scotton
description: Splat the Cat is nervous about his first day of school! Will he make friends? Will he like his teacher? Join Splat on his hilarious school adventure filled with mishaps and surprises.

title: Rainbow Fish
author: Marcus Pfister
description: Rainbow Fish has beautiful, shimmering scales but no friends. He learns that sharing his most prized possessions can bring the greatest happiness.

title: The Hundred Dresses
author: Eleanor Estes
description: Wanda is teased by her classmates for wearing the same blue dress every day. This isn’t helped by a lie she tells which snowballs out of control. But, her friend Maddie then shows extraordinary kindness and stands up for her. Ideal to discuss with your 1st grade child.

title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
author: Beatrix Potter
description: Peter disobeys his mother and sneaks into Mr. McGregor's garden. A narrow escape and a tummy ache teach him a lesson in this classic tale.

title: Knuffle Bunny
author: Mo Willems
description: Trixie goes with her father to the Laundromat. But she leaves something behind. No! It’s Knufflebunny her favorite toy! How can she explain to her father when she has yet to utter her first word? A touching and fun 1st grade reading book.

title: Because of Winn-Dixie
author: Kate DiCamillo
description: Ten-year-old Opal adopts a stray dog and names him after the grocery store where she found him. Winn-Dixie helps her make friends in her new town.

title: Officer Buckle and Gloria
author: Peggy Rathmann
description: One of the funniest winners of the Caldecott Medal, this story of unlikely friends getting over a misunderstanding is a sure-fire crowd-pleaser. Officer Buckle knows more about safety than anyone in the town of Napville. But whenever he tries to share his safety tips, nobody listens. Until, that ...

title: Stellaluna
author: Janell Cannon
description: A baby bat is raised like a bird until reunited with its mother.

title: The Relatives Came
author: Cynthia Rylant
description: In a rainbow-colored station wagon that smelled like a real car, the relatives came. When they arrived, they hugged and hugged from the kitchen to the front room. All summer they tended the garden and ate up all the strawberries and melons. They plucked banjos and strummed guitars. When they fina...

title: Miss Nelson Is Missing!
author: Harry Allard
description: The kids in Room 207 take advantage of their teacher's good nature until she disappears and they are faced with a substitute.

title: The Mitten
author: Jan Brett
description: In this bestselling modern classic, a young boy’s lost mitten leads to a charming snowy adventure. Jan Brett’s beautiful retelling is a family favorite and the board book edition is the perfect gift for the youngest readers. When Nicki drops his white mitten in the snow, he goes on without realiz...

title: Lilly's Purple Plastic Purse
author: Kevin Henkes
description: Lilly loves everything about school, especially her cool teacher, Mr. Slinger. But when Lilly brings her purple plastic purse and its treasures to school and can't wait until sharing time, Mr. Slinger confiscates her prized possessions. Lilly's fury leads to revenge and then to remorse and she se...

title: Strega Nona
author: Tomie dePaola
description: Why mosquitoes buzz in people's ears. A tall tale sets off a chain of mishaps in the jungle.

title: The Snowy Day and Other Stories
author: Ezra Jack Keats
description: Collection of large scale, full page, colour photographs of single flowers, leaves or seed heads, accompanied by a description of the author's career in floristry, her attitude to working with flowers and the development of her florist shop, Grandiflora. The photographer's work has featured in ma...

title: Curious George
author: H.A. Rey
description: George is a good little monkey, but he's always curious! His curiosity leads to mischief and adventure, but his friend the Man with the Yellow Hat is always there to help.

title: Make Way for Ducklings
author: Robert McCloskey
description: Mrs. Mallard has the unenviable task of guiding her troop of ducklings across the city of Boston to the Public Gardens. But lots of interesting people help her along the way.

title: Sylvester and the Magic Pebble
author: William Steig
description: The amazing bone: On her way home from school, Pearl finds an unusual bone that has unexpected powers.

title: The Giving Tree
author: Shel Silverstein
description: A young boy and a tree form a special bond that lasts a lifetime. As the boy grows, the tree gives generously in this moving tale about love and giving.

title: Swimmy
author: Leo Lionni
description: Swimmy, a small black fish, finds a way to protect a school of small red fish from their natural enemies.

title: Titch
author: Pat Hutchins
description: Titch is the smallest in his family. His brother and sister have bigger things than him—until Titch plants a tiny seed that grows bigger than anything! A story about finding your own strengths.

title: Chicken Soup with Rice
author: Maurice Sendak
description: Each month is gay, each season nice, when eating chicken soup with rice./DIV

title: A Bargain for Frances
author: Russell Hoban
description: Little Bear and his friends are on hand to welcome Father Bear home from his fishing trip. 'Little Bear has endeared himself as a character with irresistible, child-like charm.' -- H.

title: Leo the Late Bloomer
author: Robert Kraus
description: 1.You'll need a friend to play this game. 2. Cut out the target and hang it on a wall. 3. Ready, aim, fire! Launch your sticky spider at the target. 4. Take turns and keep track of your points. The first player to reach 150 points wins.

title: The Little Engine That Could
author: Watty Piper
description: A little blue engine agrees to pull a heavy train over a steep mountain when bigger engines refuse. 'I think I can, I think I can' becomes a mantra of determination!

title: Chicka Chicka Boom Boom
author: Bill Martin Jr.
description: A told B, and B told C, 'I'll meet you at the top of the coconut tree!' A rhythmic alphabet adventure where all the letters race to the top.

title: A Chair for My Mother
author: Vera B. Williams
description: After a fire destroys their home and possessions, Rosa, her mother, and grandmother save and save until they can afford to buy one big, comfortable chair that all three of them can enjoy.After their home is destroyed by a fire, Rosa, her mother and grandmother save their coins to buy a really com...

title: Horton Hears a Who!
author: Dr. Seuss
description: Choose kindness with Horton the elephant and the Whos of Who-ville in Dr. Seuss's classic picture book about caring for others that makes it a perfect gift! A person's a person, no matter how small. Everyone's favorite elephant stars in this heartwarming and timeless story for readers of all ages...

title: The Polar Express
author: Chris Van Allsburg
description: On Christmas Eve, a magical train takes a boy to the North Pole to meet Santa. A journey about believing in the magic of Christmas.

title: Blueberries for Sal
author: Robert McCloskey
description: CALDECOTT HONOR BOOK • NATIONAL BESTSELLER • Adored by generations of readers, this gorgeously illustrated classic tells a tale of youth, curiosity, and delight as a little girl and her mother make unexpected friends while picking blueberries in the Maine countryside. “All the color and flavor of...

title: Five Little Monkeys Jumping on the Bed
author: Eileen Christelow
description: It's bedtime at the monkey house, yet the five rambunctious little monkeys keep jumping on their bed until, one by one, each falls off and has to visit the doctor.

title: Stone Soup
author: Marcia Brown
description: When everything fails to persuade the princess to use her potty, the king and queen consult the royal advisor who gives them valuable advice.

title: Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel
author: Virginia Lee Burton
description: Although threatened by competition from modern shovels, Mike proves the worth of his trusty old steam shovel, Mary Anne.

title: Bread and Jam for Frances
author: Russell Hoban
description: Frances, one of children's best-loved characters for over 30 years, now springs to life even more in Bread and Jam for Frances,beautifully reillustrated in sparkling full color by Lillian Hoban. In this memorable story, Frances decides that bread and jam are all she wants to eat, and her understa...

title: Angelina Ballerina
author: Katharine Holabird
description: Angelina dreams of becoming a ballerina and practices her pirouettes everywhere she goes! When her parents enroll her in ballet school, her dream begins to come true.

title: Tacky the Penguin
author: Helen Lester
description: Tacky is an odd bird but definitely good to have around the iceberg.

title: Owen
author: Kevin Henkes
description: Owen had a fuzzy yellow blanket. "Fuzzy goes where I go," said Owen. But Mrs. Tweezers disagreed. She thought Owen was too old for a blanket. Owen disagreed. No matter what Mrs. Tweezers came up with, Blanket Fairies or vinegar, Owen had the answer. But when school started, Owen't mother knew jus...

title: The Little House
author: Virginia Lee Burton
description: A country house is unhappy when the city, with all its buildings and traffic, grows up around her.

title: Miss Rumphius
author: Barbara Cooney
description: Alice made a promise to make the world a more beautiful place, then a seed of an idea is planted and blossoms into a beautiful plan. This beloved classic and celebration of nature—written by a beloved Caldecott winner—is lovelier than ever! Barbara Cooney's story of Alice Rumphius, who longed to ...

title: The Napping House
author: Audrey Wood
description: A cozy bed, a snoring granny, a dreaming child, a dozing dog, a snoozing--WAIT! There's a surprise in store, and little ones will want to discover it over and over again. So pull on your sleeping cap and snuggle in for a timeless cumulative tale that's truly like no other. Don and Audrey Wood's b...

title: Stone Fox
author: John Reynolds Gardiner
description: There's just no stopping little Willy. Determined to keep their farm going -- and to give his ailing grandfather a reason to live -- the ten-year-old boy hitches his dog, Searchlight, to the plow and harvests the whole potato crop. Now little Willy needs five hundred dollars to pay off ten years'...

title: Cat Kid Comic Club
author: Dav Pilkey
description: A brand-new graphic novel series by Dav Pilkey, the internationally bestselling author and illustrator of the Dog Man and Captain Underpants series. Readers of all ages will unleash their own creativity as they open the door to visual comic-book storytelling with the help of Dav Pilkey and his he...

title: Unicorn Diaries: Bo's Magical New Friend
author: Rebecca Elliott
description: Bo grants the goblin princess a wish in this magical early chapter book from the USA Today bestselling author of Owl Diaries! Pick a book. Grow a Reader! This series is part of Scholastic's early chapter book line, Branches, aimed at newly independent readers. With easy-to-read text, high-interes...

title: Dragon Masters: Rise of the Earth Dragon
author: Tracey West
description: Snatched up by a royal soldier and carried away to the castle, 8-year-old Drake trains along with three other children to become Dragon Masters who must discover their assigned dragons' special powers. By the best-selling author of the Hiro's Quest series. Simultaneous.

title: The Bad Seed
author: Jory John
description: The Bad Seed has a bad attitude, bad manners, and a bad temper. But was he always bad? A surprisingly touching story about how it's never too late to change your ways.

title: The Good Egg
author: Jory John
description: An instant New York Times bestseller! From the bestselling creators of The Bad Seed, a timely story about not having to be Grade A perfect! Meet the good egg. He’s a verrrrrry good egg indeed. But trying to be so good is hard when everyone else is plain ol’ rotten. As the other eggs in the dozen ...

title: Hilo: The Boy Who Crashed to Earth
author: Judd Winick
description: "An action-packed page turner with heart!"—Dav Pilkey, author of DOG MAN Take off on an action packed adventure with HILO Book 3! Dog Man meets Big Nate in this hilarious New York Times bestselling graphic novel series that kids love! Aah!!!! Everyone's favorite space boy is BACK! Hilo may look l...

title: We Don't Eat Our Classmates
author: Ryan T. Higgins
description: "The Storyteller Queen lives, and her name is E. K. Johnston." -- Rachel Hartman, New York Times best-selling author of Seraphina The follow-up to A Thousand Nights, Spindle is the feminist retelling of Sleeping Beauty where the princess saves herself and owns the narrative. The prison is crumbli...

title: Isamu Noguchi
author: Hana Awakuni
description: The ultimate kids' book about dogs, being good, being bad, and being yourself! From the award-winning, critically acclaimed author of Petra. Meet Buzz the dog. He's such a good boy. Buzz seems to have a perfect life .. . and a lot of very well-behaved friends. Buzz would never dream of being anyt...

title: Julian Is a Mermaid
author: Jessica Love
description: In an exuberant picture book, a glimpse of costumed mermaids leaves one boy flooded with wonder and ready to dazzle the world. While riding the subway home from the pool with his abuela one day, Julián notices three women spectacularly dressed up. Their hair billows in brilliant hues, their dress...

title: Hey, Water!
author: Antoinette Portis
description: "The story of Daniel Ellsberg and his decision to steal and publish secret documents about America's involvement in the Vietnam War"--

title: The Proudest Blue
author: Ibtihaj Muhammad
description: THE INSTANT NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER! A powerful, vibrantly illustrated story about the first day of school--and two sisters on one's first day of hijab--by Olympic medalist and social justice activist Ibtihaj Muhammad. With her new backpack and light-up shoes, Faizah knows the first day of scho...

title: Eyes That Kiss in the Corners
author: Joanna Ho
description: This lyrical and stunning picture book tells a story about learning to love and celebrate your Asian-shaped eyes, in the of spirit of Hair Love by Matthew A. Cherry A young Asian girl notices that her eyes look different from her peers'. They have big, round eyes and long lashes. She realizes tha...

title: Fry Bread: A Native American Family Story
author: Kevin Noble Maillard
description: Fry bread is food. Fry bread is time, place, and nation. This lyrical celebration explores the history and meaning of fry bread to Indigenous communities across America.

title: The Pigeon HAS to Go to School!
author: Mo Willems
description: All it takes to face your fears is a little bit of Princess Power! --Amazon

title: Dragons in a Bag
author: Zetta Elliott
description: This fun role-reversal picture book will help reluctant students get excited to go back to school! It's just another school morning...until Mom, Dad, Grandma, and even Bow-wow the dog BEG the kids to let them come to school, too! Dad can tie his own shoes--why can't he come? Mom is all ready with...

title: Ada Twist, Scientist
author: Andrea Beaty
description: Ada Twist is a very curious girl who shows perseverance by asking questions and performing experiments to find things out and understand the world.

title: Sofia Valdez, Future Prez
author: Andrea Beaty
description: Discover Louisa May Alcott's classic novel--now featuring gorgeous photos from Greta Gerwig's big-screen adaptation--in this stunning keepsake reproduction of the book as seen in the film Readers have been falling for the timeless story of sisters Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy as they navigate hardship ...

title: The Rabbit Listened
author: Cori Doerrfeld
description: In a forest filled with treacherous beasts, the thing to be most afraid of is closer than you think in this middle grade horror fantasy. Kestrel, a young huntress, lives in a seemingly endless forest crawling with dangerous beasts. But the most dangerous beasts of all are the Grabbers--beings tha...

title: A Is for Awesome!: 23 Iconic Women Who Changed the World
author: Eva Chen
description: In the third book in the Mitford Murders series, lady's maid Louisa Cannon accompanies Diana Mitford into a turbulent late 1920s Europe. The year is 1928, and after the death of a maid at a glamorous society party, fortune heir Bryan Guinness seizes life and proposes to eighteen-year-old Diana, m...

title: Bob Books Set 1: Beginning Readers
author: Bobby Lynn Maslen
description: Bob Books Set 1: Beginning Readers Teach a child letter sounds with Bob Books Set 1! With four letters in the first story, children can read a whole book. Consistent new sounds are added gradually, until young readers have read books with all letters of the alphabet (except Q). Short vowels and t...

title: Eerie Elementary: The School Is Alive!
author: Jack Chabert
description: Sam Graves discovers his new elementary school is ALIVE and up to no good! The floors shake, the walls groan, and strange things happen. Can Sam survive Eerie Elementary?

title: Diary of a Pug: Pug Blasts Off
author: Kyla May
description: Rainbow Tinseltail (called Bo) has never actually seen a dragon, but when things start going missing from Sparklegrove School for Unicorns all clues seem to point to a dragon pup called Scorch--but when Scorch does not return to the dragon caves, Bo and her friends become worried that he has gott...

title: Yasmin the Fashionista
author: Saadia Faruqi
description: Yasmin is a spirited second-grader who's always on the lookout for new things to try! In this story, she explores her creative side and discovers her own unique fashion sense.

title: Balloons Over Broadway
author: Melissa Sweet
description: Presents a tribute to the creator of the giant balloons that fill the sky during the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, tracing the work of artist Tony Sarg, whose innovative "upside-down puppet" creations have become the parade's trademark.

title: Drawn Together
author: Minh Lê
description: A boy and his grandfather don't speak the same language, but they communicate through art. A wordless connection blooms as they draw together, bridging cultures and generations.

title: Hair Love
author: Matthew A. Cherry
description: A New York Times Bestseller and tie-in to Academy-Award Winning Short Film "Hair Love" "I love that Hair Love is highlighting the relationship between a Black father and daughter. Matthew leads the ranks of new creatives who are telling unique stories of the Black experience. We need this." - Jor...

title: All Are Welcome
author: Alexandra Penfold
description: Now in paperback, the first book--an instant bestseller--in the sumptuous, sultry, and romantic YA vampire series from New York Times bestselling author Renee Ahdieh. In 1872, New Orleans is a city ruled by the dead. But to seventeen-year-old Celine Rousseau, New Orleans is a safe haven after she...

title: The Notebook of Doom: Rise of the Balloon Goons
author: Troy Cummings
description: Help your kids learn to read with Lego DC Super Heroes. Includes short and long vowel sounds: A, E, I, O, U.

title: Noodleheads See the Future
author: Tedd Arnold
description: How many simple machines do you use every day? Probably more than you realize! Machines make work easier— helping break things apart, lift heavy objects, and change the power and direction of force applied to them. In this accessible picture book, celebrated nonfiction author David A. Adler outli...

title: Mae Among the Stars
author: Roda Ahmed
description: An Amazon Best Book of the Month A beautiful picture book for sharing, inspired by the life of the first African American woman to travel in space, Mae Jemison. A great classroom and bedtime read-aloud, Mae Among the Stars is the perfect book for young readers who have big dreams and even bigger ...

title: Perfectly Norman
author: Tom Percival
description: "A beautiful tribute to every queer kid who's ever had to leave their home in order to find one." - Leah Johnson, bestselling author of You Should See Me in a Crown The author of The Gravity of Us crafts another heartfelt coming-of-age story about finding the people who become your home--perfect ...

title: The Invisible Boy
author: Trudy Ludwig
description: Bradley, Brian, Nate, and Lucy try to help out the Flying Fortunatos, an acrobatic troupe with a very shabby traveling circus, by identifying the marvelous, hooded trapeze artist they spied rehearsing.

title: Thunder Boy Jr.
author: Sherman Alexie
description: Thunder Boy Jr. is named after his dad, but he wants a name that's all his own. Just because people call his dad Big Thunder doesn't mean he wants to be Little Thunder. He wants a name that celebrates something cool he's done, like Touch the Clouds, Not Afraid of Ten Thousand Teeth, or Full of Wo...

title: The Adventures of Beekle
author: Dan Santat
description: Winner of the 2015 Caldecott Medal This magical story begins on an island far away where an imaginary friend is born. He patiently waits his turn to be chosen by a real child, but when he is overlooked time and again, he sets off on an incredible journey to the bustling city, where he finally mee...

title: Jabari Jumps
author: Gaia Cornwall
description: A young mathematical genius from India searches for the secrets hidden inside numbers — and for someone who understands him — in this gorgeous picture-book biography. A mango . . . is just one thing. But if I chop it in two, then chop the half in two, and keep on chopping, I get more and more bit...

title: The Name Jar
author: Yangsook Choi
description: A heartwarming story about the new girl in school, and how she learns to appreciate her Korean name. Being the new kid in school is hard enough, but what happens when nobody can pronounce your name? Having just moved from Korea, Unhei is anxious about fitting in. So instead of introducing herself...

title: Rocket Writes a Story
author: Tad Hills
description: "The companion to Liar, liar; Flat broke; Crush; & Vote"--Dust jacket.

title: The Undefeated
author: Kwame Alexander
description: This powerful poem is a love letter to Black life in America, celebrating the strength, resilience, and beauty of Black heroes past and present. Originally performed at the Oscars.

title: The Word Collector
author: Peter H. Reynolds
description: A brave young protagonist must rely on his wits and his friends to navigate dangers and escape an unwelcome fate in this action-packed historical novel. As the son of famous Black Jack Valera, the best whaler on the eastern seaboard, thirteen-year-old Cape Verdean Lucky Valera has led a charmed l...

title: Love in the Library
author: Maggie Tokuda-Hall
description: Five beautifully illustrated spreads show a series of baby animals hiding behind bright felt flaps. A textile, sensory read that's perfect for sharing with babies and toddlers, featuring a mirror reveal on the final spread. Five beautifully illustrated spreads show a series of baby animals hiding...

title: Ava Lin, Super Duper Happy
author: Vicky Fang
description: The explosive finale to the New York Times and USA Today bestselling Shatter Me series. Juliette Ferrars. Ella Sommers. Which is the truth and which is the lie? Now that Ella knows who Juliette is and what she was created for, things have only become more complicated. As she struggles to understa...

title: Stand Up, Yumi Chung!
author: Jessica Kim
description: Friendship--and trains!--take center stage in this gentle, inviting story about paying attention to other people's feelings. Two boys' fun train-track-building project takes a turn when one of the boys obliviously insists on only doing things his way. Their disagreement spells disaster for the tr...

title: A Place Inside of Me
author: Zetta Elliott
description: A young Black girl explores the many emotions she holds inside—joy, anger, fear, and pride. This poetic journey validates all feelings and the space they deserve.

title: Saturday
author: Oge Mora
description: In this warm and tender story by the Caldecott Honor-winning creator of Thank You, Omu!, join a mother and daughter on an up-and-down journey that reminds them of what's best about Saturdays: precious time together. Today would be special. Today would be splendid. It was Saturday! But sometimes, ...

title: I Am Enough
author: Grace Byers
description: I Am Enough is the picture book everyone needs, and it's now a New York Times bestseller! This is a gorgeous, lyrical ode to loving who you are, respecting others, and being kind to one another—from Empire actor and activist Grace Byers and talented newcomer artist Keturah A. Bobo. This is the pe...

title: Sulwe
author: Lupita Nyong'o
description: A New York Times bestseller! Featured in its own episode in the Netflix original show Bookmarks: Celebrating Black Voices! Recipient of a Coretta Scott King Illustrator Honor Award Recipient of an NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Children’s Literary Work From Academy Award–winning actress Lupita...

title: Dreamers
author: Yuyi Morales
description: We are resilience. We are hope. We are dreamers. Yuyi Morales brought her hopes, her passion, her strength, and her stories with her, when she came to the United States in 1994 with her infant son. She left behind nearly everything she owned, but she didn't come empty-handed. From the author-illu...

title: The Barnabus Project
author: The Fan Brothers
description: Barnabus is a half-mouse, half-elephant creature who dreams of freedom. When he discovers his fate as a 'Failed Project,' he must escape and find where he truly belongs.

title: Sam and Dave Dig a Hole
author: Mac Barnett
description: A 2015 Caldecott Honor Book With perfect pacing, the multi-award-winning, New York Times best-selling team of Mac Barnett and Jon Klassen dig down for a deadpan tale full of visual humor. Sam and Dave are on a mission. A mission to find something spectacular. So they dig a hole. And they keep dig...

title: Extra Yarn
author: Mac Barnett
description: This looks like an ordinary box full of ordinary yarn. But it turns out it isn’t.

title: Wolf in the Snow
author: Matthew Cordell
description: When a wolf cub and little girl are lost in a snowstorm they must find their way home.

title: The Day the Crayons Quit
author: Drew Daywalt
description: The hilarious, colorful #1 New York Times bestselling phenomenon that every kid wants! Gift a copy to someone you love today. Poor Duncan just wants to color. But when he opens his box of crayons, he finds only letters, all saying the same thing: His crayons have had enough! They quit! Blue crayo...

title: The Day the Crayons Came Home
author: Drew Daywalt
description: The companion to the #1 New York Times bestseller and blockbuster hit, The Day the Crayons Quit! A Wall Street Journal Best Children's Book of 2015 A TIME Magazine Top 10 Children's Book of 2015 “Highly anticipated (yes, even for adults)” —Entertainment Weekly I'm not sure what it is about this k...

title: The Book with No Pictures
author: B.J. Novak
description: A #1 New York Times bestseller, this innovative and wildly funny read-aloud by award-winning humorist/actor B.J. Novak will turn any reader into a comedian—a perfect gift for any special occasion! You might think a book with no pictures seems boring and serious. Except . . . here’s how books work...

title: Bear Has a Story to Tell
author: Philip C. Stead
description: Bear, with the help of his animal friends, remembers the story he had hoped to tell before the onset of winter. Full color.

title: A Sick Day for Amos McGee
author: Philip C. Stead
description: Zookeeper Amos McGee always makes time to visit his friends who live at the zoo until the day he stays home because he is sick.

title: This Is Not My Hat
author: Jon Klassen
description: A little fish thinks he can get away with stealing a hat.

title: I Want My Hat Back
author: Jon Klassen
description: A bear almost gives up his search for his missing hat until he remembers something important, in a cumulative tale with a mischievous twist.

title: Interrupting Chicken
author: David Ezra Stein
description: Little Red Chicken wants Papa to read her a bedtime story, but interrupts him almost as soon as he begins each tale.

title: That Is Not a Good Idea!
author: Mo Willems
description: A surprising lesson about the importance of listening to one's inner gosling ensues when a very hungry fox issues a dinner invitation to a very plump goose. By the Caldecott Honor-winning creator of Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus! 200,000 first printing.

title: Not Quite Narwhal
author: Jessie Sima
description: National Book Award winner William Alexander conjures up a spooky adventure full of excitement in this entertaining sequel to A Properly Unhaunted Place, which was a New York Times Editors’ Choice. Rosa Diaz has her hands full of ghosts. She saved the town of Ingot by unleashing all the ghosts wh...

title: Please, Mr. Panda
author: Steve Antony
description: Mr. Panda has a plate of doughnuts to share, but most of the other animals forget to say "Please."

title: Little Blue Truck
author: Alice Schertle
description: A small blue truck finds his way out of a jam, with a little help from his friends.

title: Duck on a Bike
author: David Shannon
description: A duck decides to ride a bike and soon influences all the other animals on the farm to ride bikes too.

title: No, David!
author: David Shannon
description: A young boy is depicted doing a variety of naughty things for which he is repeatedly admonished, but finally he gets a hug.

title: Shark vs. Train
author: Chris Barton
description: Shark VS. Train! WHO WILL WIN?! If you think Superman vs. Batman would be an exciting matchup, wait until you see Shark vs. Train. In this hilarious and wacky picture book, Shark and Train egg each other on for one competition after another, including burping, bowling, Ping Pong, piano playing, p...

title: The Watermelon Seed
author: Greg Pizzoli
description: When a crocodile accidentally swallows a watermelon seed, he's convinced a watermelon will grow in his belly! His friends try to reassure him in this silly story about worrying.

title: Llama Llama Mad at Mama
author: Anna Dewdney
description: Yucky music, great big feet. Ladies smelling way too sweet. Look at knees and stand in line. Llama Llama starts to whine. Does any child like to go shopping? Not Llama Llama! But Mama can’t leave Llama at home, so off they go to Shop-O-Rama. Lots of aisles. Long lines. Mama is too busy to notice ...

title: Should I Share My Ice Cream?
author: Mo Willems
description: Gerald the Elephant has an ice cream cone, but should he share it with Piggie? Mo Willems explores friendship and sharing with humor and heart in this easy reader.

title: Erno Rubik and His Magic Cube
author: Kerry O'Malley Cerra
description: The fascinating story of Erno Rubik, the Hungarian inventor who created the world's most popular puzzle. Learn how curiosity and persistence led to the Rubik's Cube!

title: I'm Trying to Love Math
author: Bethany Barton
description: A skeptical narrator tries to find reasons to love math, with hilarious commentary and colorful illustrations. Even math-phobes will giggle their way through this book!

title: Unicorn and Yeti: Sparkly New Friends
author: Heather Ayris Burnell
description: What is that fat guy in the red suit doing on the roof? wonders Minerva Louise one snowy evening. She follows him down the chimney and, to her surprise, sees a big tree inside. The harebrained hen can?t make any sense of it, but young children will cackle with delight as they follow Minerva aroun...

title: Squeak! 100 Fun Facts About Hamsters
author: Sarah L. Thomson
description: It's the 10th anniversary of the world's best-selling infopedia for kids! This year, it includes all new content, interviews with explorers in each chapter, a special look at what was going on in the world when the first National Geographic Kids Infopedia came out 10 years ago, plus the results f...

title: Libby Loves Science: States of Matter
author: Kimberly Derting
description: Libby loves asking questions and doing experiments! Join her as she explores solids, liquids, and gases through fun, hands-on science discoveries.

title: I Want to Be an Engineer
author: Dan Green
description: What began with a peach basket on a post is now one of the world's hottest sports! Young would-be LeBrons can learn all about assists, blocks, dribbles, foul balls, jump shots, pivots, passes, rebounds, and steals. They'll also see what to do to improve--including doing 100 layups and practicing ...

title: Beak & Ally: Unlikely Friends
author: Norm Feuti
description: Beak the bird and Ally the alligator seem like an unlikely pair, but sometimes the best friendships come from the most unexpected places. A sweet story about accepting differences.

title: Otter: The Best Job Ever!
author: Sam Garton
description: Hi everyone, This book is pretty much our official story so far. It really does seem only like last week we played our first gig at the Annandale Hotel in Sydney. Since then we've been given the opportunity to turn into the people and musicians we wanted to be. The people who gave us the opportun...

title: Gigi and Ojiji: What's in a Name?
author: Melissa Iwai
description: Gigi wonders about her Japanese name and what it means. When her Ojiji (grandfather) visits from Japan, they explore the special meanings and stories behind both their names.

title: Bear and Bird: The Stars and Other Stories
author: Jarvis
description: Bear and Bird are best friends who share three gentle adventures—stargazing, nest-building, and more. Perfect for bedtime with soft illustrations and tender moments.

title: See the Cat: Three Stories About a Dog
author: David LaRochelle
description: Winner of the Newbery Medal A New York Times Bestseller Thoughtful, strong-willed sixth-grader Merci Suarez navigates difficult changes with friends, family, and everyone in between in a resonant new novel from Meg Medina. Merci Suarez knew that sixth grade would be different, but she had no idea...

title: Everything Awesome About Space
author: Mike Lowery
description: "In this revised collection of classic Wild Cards stories, the spotlight is on the most unusual Wild Cards of them all--the Deuces, or people with minor superpowers. In Deuces Down, iconic celebrities and landmark events are seen in a whole new light, such as John Jos. Miller's exciting 1969 Worl...

title: Dryg and Rex: Forever Friends
author: Molly Idle
description: Explore the importance of happiness with the youngest readers in a wonderfully accessible way. Even little children have big questions about life. Finding happiness is a lifelong goal and Aristotle thought deeply about it. Why are we here? What is the best way to live a happy life? Having friends...

title: Ty's Travels: Showtime!
author: Kelly Starling Lyons
description: "Knox works to keep his family together as they move from Hong Kong back to northern California during the initial outbreak of the coronavirus."--

title: Owl and Penguin
author: Vikram Madan
description: From the author of Stand Up, Yumi Chung! comes a funny and utterly charming novel about friends—how to make them, how to let go of them, and how to be your own BFF. This is the story of Sunny Park, a seventh-grade student at Ranchito Mesa Middle who loves the K-pop band Supreme Beat, hanging out ...

title: What If You Had an Animal Tail?
author: Sandra Markle
description: What if you woke up with an animal tail? Would you want a monkey's balancing tail, a lizard's snap-off tail, or a beaver's flat swimming tail? Explore amazing animal adaptations!

title: The Newest Princess
author: Jess M. Brallier
description: When a new princess arrives at the castle, the royal family must adjust to having a baby around. A funny, modern take on welcoming a new sibling.

title: Reina Ramos Works It Out
author: Emma Otheguy
description: Reina Ramos faces a problem: her abuelo is coming to visit, but she wants to play with her friends! Can she find a way to make everyone happy?

title: China
author: Mary Meinking
description: It's no doubt that animals lead awesome, exciting lives, and this series shares those adventures with readers through clear text, vibrant photography, and engaging graphics that emphasize visual literacy. With simple text, clear images, and labeled graphics, teaches beginning readers about pengui...

title: Truth or Lie: Dogs!
author: Erica S. Perl
description: Can you spot the truth from the lies about dogs? This interactive book presents wild facts—some true, some false. Test your knowledge and learn surprising dog facts!

title: Ricky Ricotta's Mighty Robot
author: Dav Pilkey
description: General Jackrabbit and his Robo-Rabbits from Jupiter attempt to take over the world on Ricky Ricotta's birthday.

title: Facts vs. Opinions vs. Robots
author: Michael Rex
description: NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER • Stephen Hawking’s closest collaborator offers the intellectual superstar’s final thoughts on the cosmos—a dramatic revision of the theory he put forward in A Brief History of Time. “This superbly written book offers insight into an extraordinary individual, the creativ...

title: Hornbeam All In
author: Joshua Farman Schuster
description: Hornbeam the tree has stood in the same spot for years, watching the world change around him. When he finally decides to join in, wonderful things happen!

title: Mittens
author: Lola M. Schaefer
description: Mittens is a kitten who sees everything as an adventure! Whether it's a cardboard box or a paper bag, Mittens finds joy in simple things.

title: Fox the Tiger
author: Corey R. Tabor
description: An instant New York Times bestseller, Booki Vivat's Frazzled is the first installment of a funny middle grade graphic novel series about a girl who is always in a tizzy. “Hilarious.” (NPR’s All Things Considered) "Honest, sweet, and laugh-out-loud funny. Fans of Smile and Diary of a Wimpy Kid wil...

title: Mel Fell
author: Corey R. Tabor
description: #1 New York Times bestselling author Ilona Andrews is back with the newest book in the exciting Hidden Legacy series--the thrilling conclusion to her trilogy featuring fierce and beautiful Prime magic user Catalina Baylor. An escaped spider, the unexpected arrival of an Imperial Russian Prince, t...

title: Hooray for Amanda and Her Alligator!
author: Mo Willems
description: Amanda has an alligator. Not a toy alligator, but a REAL alligator! Mo Willems brings his signature humor to this absurd and delightful friendship.

title: Worm and Caterpillar Are Friends
author: Kaz Windness
description: A hop-py bunny prepares for the perfect Easter celebration in this adorable Easter Wag My Tail novelty book from award-winning creator Salina Yoon. Will Bunny find the perfect Easter egg on her favorite day of the year? Help Bunny wag her fluffy cottontail whenever she finds a new egg. With a stu...

title: I Really Want to Be First!
author: Jane Chapman
description: With more than 70 flaps to lift and fun facts to discover in every scene, little ones will love learning about the farm and the amazing animals that live there. Children can explore what’s behind the huge straw bale, which creatures are swimming in the pond, who lives in the farmhouse, and more. ...

title: The World Belonged to Us
author: Jacqueline Woodson
description: There’s a world of summer adventure in store for the kids in Brooklyn in this vibrant and joyful picture book. Celebrating freedom and adventure, the children in this story turn the streets into their playground, chase ice cream trucks, and believe everything is possible – until it’s time for dinner. It’s an inspiring book for children and a nostalgic story for parents and teachers.

title: Blue Sky White Stars
author: Sarvinder Naberhaus
description: Sarvinder Naberhaus paints a vivid portrait of America in this poignant illustrated children’s book. With short, poetic, and bilingual prose, she explores the nation’s history and values through iconic imagery. The American flag, the enduring spirit, and the diverse tapestry of culture that define the United States are all brought to life for young readers.

title: The Book Hog
author: Greg Pizzoli
description: The book hog adores books – any books. He feels the pages with his hooves. He sniffs the pages and loves the pictures. However, he has a secret that mustn’t be told. He can’t read! Follow his journey to the library for story time and the joy when he learns to read. A great picture book to encourage younger readers.

title: The True Story of the Three Little Pigs
author: Jon Scieszka
description: The traditional tale of the Three Little Pigs is retold by the Wolf, and it wasn’t his fault. A very funny reimagining of this story with great illustrations. A perfect book for grade 1 group and shared reading.

title: Freckle Juice
author: Judy Blume
description: Andrew’s best friend Nicky has freckles, and Andrew wants them so badly he’ll do anything to get some. Then Sharon offers him a secret recipe to grow freckles.

title: The Boy Who Loved Words
author: Roni Schotter
description: Selig doesn’t collect action figures or trading cards – he collects words. Words which make him giggle or words which sound nice to say. An excellent book to spark your child’s interest in language.

title: There is a Bird on Your Head!
author: Mo Willems
description: Gerald the Elephant gets extremely irritated by a series of birds that camp out on his head. Can his friend Piggie help him out?

title: Ramona the Pest
author: Beverly Cleary
description: Ramona is excited to start school for the first time. But things don’t go to plan and she’s in trouble from the first moment. Will she work out what she’s doing wrong? A thought-provoking 1st grade reading book.

title: Diary of a Wombat
author: Jackie French
description: The daily life of a wombat is not at all what you might expect. A very funny look at life from a different point of view. A funny 1st grade reading picture book.

title: Hot Hot Hot
author: Neal Layton
description: Oscar and Arabella don’t like summer. Heat, flies, sweat, insects are not for them – because they are woolly mammoths. But then they come up with a very clever idea.

title: Tuesday
author: David Wiesner
description: A stunningly imaginative picture book with strange and fantastical images including frogs on flying lily pads. There are no words in this book – which makes it ideal for helping your child tell the story and develop a rich and descriptive use of language. An ideal first grade reading book to share.

title: 365 Penguins
author: Jean Luc Fromental
description: Imagine you wake up each day to find a penguin delivered to your front door. Who is sending them, what should you do with them, and where do you put them? A great picture story for helping 1st grade children to count and use their imagination.

title: Diary of a Worm
author: Doreen Cronin
description: A funny story about life from the point of view of a worm. Homework can be eaten, baths are not necessary and mud is fine everywhere. But there’s one thing the worm wishes he could do.

title: Uneversaurus
author: Aidan Potts
description: A clever book all about dinosaurs which encourages children to imagine for themselves what these creatures looked, like, sounded like and felt like.

title: Water Boy
author: David McPhail
description: A moving fantasy story. When a teacher tells a boy that people are mostly made out of water, he begins to panic. What if he dissolves? What if he goes down the plughole at bath time? But when he deals with fears, amazing and unexpected things start to happen. A great book for 1st grade children.

title: The Dot
author: Peter H Reynolds
description: Vashti sits through art class looking at her blank piece of paper. She hates art. But her teacher tells her, “Just make a mark and see where it takes you.” A world of creativity is opened up in this memorable story about overcoming a fear of failure.

title: When Sheep Cannot Sleep
author: Satoshi Kitamura
description: A story about a sheep who goes to extraordinary lengths to get to sleep, by going outside and counting everything he meets. A great story for developing math and memory skills.

title: When Will I Read?
author: Miriam Cohen
description: Ideal for children struggling to read in first grade. A heartwarming story about how different people learn in different ways.

title: And I Mean It, Stanley
author: Crosby Bonsall
description: A fun and madcap story about a girl and her pet and the imaginative ideas she has to build something from nothing. This is an ideal first grade book for more confident readers.

title: The Grouchy Ladybug
author: Eric Carle
description: An amazing book about a grumpy and rude ladybug who refuses to say please or thank you or be polite in any way. Great collage illustrations from the author of The Very Hungry Caterpillar.

title: Sheep in a Jeep
author: Nancy Shaw
description: A group of sheep decides to see if they can all fit into a Jeep. Then they think of all sorts of unlikely places they can drive to, and nothing quite goes to plan. A very funny book ideal for more reluctant readers.

title: Morris the Moose
author: Bernard Wiseman
description: Morris, a toothy-grinned Moose, encounters some strange new animals for the first time and assumes each one is a strange kind of moose. But the Cow has other ideas. A story of unlikely friendship.

title: How do Dinosaurs Say Goodnight?
author: Jane Yolen
description: A fly on the wall story of the life of dinosaurs, including dinosaur bedtimes, dinosaur dinner, and dinosaur tantrums. Great pictures.

title: Bats at the Beach
author: Brian Lies
description: A night out at the beach with a group of bats – including moon tan lotion and toasting bug-mallows. A very original rhyming story.

title: Cloud Tea Monkeys
author: Mal Peet
description: A heartwarming story about a girl whose mother is too ill to work. Set in the foothills of the Himalayas, Tashi is helped by magic monkeys to find the most valuable tea leaves in the land. Based on a Chinese legend. Ideal to read aloud to grade 1 children.

title: How to Clean a Hippopotamus
author: Robin Page
description: A clever book about how animals help each other. By posing questions such as the story title, the book explores how living things work together in harmony.

title: The Retired Kid
author: Jon Agee
description: Brian has had enough of school, homework, chores and being told off – so he decides to retire and live at the Sunset Retirement Community. However, Brian’s new life isn’t quite what he’d imagined.

title: The Boy Who Loved Math: The Improbable Life of Paul Erdős
author: Deborah Heiligman
description: The story of Paul Erdős, one of the most brilliant mathematicians of the 20th century, who saw math everywhere and loved numbers more than anything else.

title: Counting on Katherine: How Katherine Johnson Saved Apollo 13
author: Helaine Becker
description: The inspiring story of Katherine Johnson, the brilliant NASA mathematician whose calculations helped save the Apollo 13 mission and paved the way for space exploration.

title: One Grain of Rice: A Mathematical Folktale
author: Demi
description: A clever girl named Rani uses exponential doubling to outsmart a selfish raja. Starting with one grain of rice that doubles each day, she teaches a powerful lesson about math and generosity.

title: Nothing Stopped Sophie: The Story of Unshakable Mathematician Sophie Germain
author: Cheryl Bardoe
description: The inspiring story of Sophie Germain, who overcame every obstacle to become one of the greatest mathematicians of all time, even when women were banned from studying math.

title: Lemonade in Winter: A Book About Two Kids Counting Money
author: Emily Jenkins
description: Pauline and John-John are determined to sell lemonade—in winter! Through their adventure, young readers learn about money, counting, and entrepreneurship.

title: Zero the Hero
author: Joan Holub
description: Zero feels like a nobody next to all the other numbers. But when numbers start disappearing, Zero proves that being nothing doesn't mean you're not important!

title: How Many Jelly Beans?: A Giant Book of Giant Numbers
author: Andrea Menotti
description: Using colorful jelly beans, this book helps kids visualize and understand large numbers, from 10 to 1 million! A deliciously fun way to learn about big numbers.

title: One Big Pair of Underwear
author: Laura Gehl
description: Ten silly animals try to share one big pair of underwear! A hilarious counting and division story that teaches about sharing and cooperation.

title: Pigeon Math
author: Asia Citro
description: When pigeons invade a park, the counting chaos begins! Addition, subtraction, and lots of silly pigeons make learning math ridiculously fun.

title: Counting the Stars: The Story of Katherine Johnson, NASA Mathematician
author: Lesa Cline-Ransome
description: From counting stars as a child to calculating rocket trajectories for NASA, this is the inspiring story of Katherine Johnson, one of the brilliant women who helped America reach the moon.

title: The Girl with a Mind for Math: The Story of Raye Montague
author: Julia Finley Mosca
description: Raye Montague loved solving problems and learning about machines. She became the first person to design a Navy ship using a computer—revolutionizing shipbuilding!

title: Lifetime: The Amazing Numbers in Animal Lives
author: Lola M. Schaefer
description: How many times does a hummingbird's heart beat in a lifetime? Explore fascinating math through amazing animal facts in this beautiful counting book.

title: When Sophie Thinks She Can't...
author: Molly Bang
description: Sophie struggles with a math problem and wants to give up. This empowering story teaches kids about persistence, problem-solving, and believing in themselves.

title: Every Dog in the Neighborhood
author: Philip C. Stead
description: A boy and his grandmother conduct a census of all the dogs in their neighborhood. A gentle story about data collection, community, and the love of dogs.

title: A Treasure of Measures
author: Mike Downs
description: Before rulers and measuring cups, how did people measure things? Take a journey through history to discover how measurement began and why it matters.

title: The Spark in Me
author: Miguel Tanco
description: Math is everywhere—from the rhythm of music to the patterns in nature! A girl discovers her passion for math and sees how it connects to the world around her.

title: Billions of Bricks: A Counting Book About Building
author: Kurt Cyrus
description: From one brick to billions, watch as workers build amazing structures using math and teamwork. A rhythmic counting book perfect for young builders!

title: Bird Count
author: Susan Edwards Richmond
description: Ava joins a real-life bird count, learning about different species and the importance of collecting data. Math meets nature in this engaging story.

title: Sheep Won't Sleep: Counting by 2s, 5s, and 10s
author: Judy Cox
description: Clarissa the sheep tries counting different animals in groups of 2s, 5s, and 10s to help a girl fall asleep. Skip counting has never been so funny!

title: Shapes, Reshape!
author: Silvia Borando
description: Circles, squares, and triangles dance across the page, transforming into new shapes and objects. A playful introduction to geometry for young learners.

title: Absolutely One Thing: Featuring Charlie and Lola
author: Lauren Child
description: Charlie is trying to sort one thing, but Lola keeps changing the categories! A hilarious introduction to sorting, classifying, and mathematical thinking.

title: The Animals Would Not Sleep
author: Sara Levine
description: Marco's stuffed animals won't go to sleep until he organizes them just right. A fun story about sorting, patterns, and problem-solving at bedtime.

title: Cao Chong Weighs an Elephant
author: Songju Ma Daemicke
description: In ancient China, young Cao Chong uses clever math to solve an impossible problem: how to weigh an elephant! Based on a true historical story.

title: Count on Me
author: Miguel Tanco
description: A girl shares her love for numbers and shows how math is everywhere—in nature, music, art, and daily life. Math has never been more beautiful!

title: Friends Beyond Measure: A Story Told with Infographics
author: Lalena Fisher
description: Follow two best friends through life using colorful infographics and data visualization. A unique way to explore friendship, time, and growing up!

title: How to Explain Coding to a Grown-Up
author: Ruth Spiro
description: A young girl teaches her mom all about coding, algorithms, and computer thinking. The perfect introduction to computer science for kids and parents!

title: Is 2 a Lot?: An Adventure with Numbers
author: Annie Watson
description: Is 2 elephants a lot? Is 2 grains of sand? A playful exploration of relative size and how numbers mean different things in different contexts.

title: Max's Math
author: Kate Banks
description: Max and his brothers explore the woods, discovering math everywhere they go. Counting, patterns, and shapes come alive in nature!

title: One Boy Watching
author: Grant Snider
description: A boy observes the world during his bus ride, noticing patterns, numbers, and connections everywhere. A meditation on mathematical thinking.

title: 100 Mighty Dragons All Named Broccoli
author: David LaRochelle
description: What happens when 100 dragons all named Broccoli show up for a party? Chaos and hilarious counting fun! A wacky introduction to large numbers.

title: The Quest for a Tangram Dragon
author: Christine Liu-Perkins
description: Li Na and her sister try to recreate a tangram dragon shape. A story about persistence, spatial reasoning, and the ancient Chinese tangram puzzle.

title: Rafa Counts on Papá
author: Joe Cepeda
description: Rafa and his father walk through their neighborhood, counting everything they see. A sweet bilingual story about family, community, and numbers.

title: 3x4
author: Ivan Brunetti
description: A clever wordless picture book that introduces multiplication through creative visual patterns and groupings. Art meets math in this stunning book!

title: Too Many Pigs and One Big Bad Wolf
author: Davide Calì
description: The three little pigs become four, then five, then more! Can the wolf keep up with all the math? A hilarious twist on the classic tale.

title: Uma Wimple Charts Her House
author: Reif Larsen
description: Uma loves making charts, maps, and diagrams of everything in her house. A celebration of data visualization and creative mathematical thinking!

title: We Are Branches
author: Joyce Sidman
description: Explore the mathematical beauty of branching patterns in nature through gorgeous illustrations and poetic text. Trees, rivers, and families all branch!

title: We Are One: How the World Adds Up
author: Susan Hood
description: One world, made up of many parts. A beautiful counting book that shows how individual pieces come together to make a whole, celebrating diversity and unity.

title: You Rule!
author: Rilla Alexander
description: Measure your world in creative ways! From feet to paper clips, this playful book shows kids how to measure anything and make their own rules.

title: Zero Zebras: A Counting Book About What's Not There
author: Bruce Goldstone
description: A unique counting book that focuses on zero and the concept of 'none.' What does it mean when something isn't there? A mind-bending math concept!
